greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest prime factor of the odd Catalan number A038003(n).
comment: a(n) <> 3 iff the base-3 representation of 2^n-1 has no 2's. Conjecture: this only occurs for n = 2, 5, 8. I verified it up to n = 10^4. - _Robert Israel_, Nov 18 2015
mathematica: f[n_] := Block[{p = 2, m = Binomial[2^(n+1)-2, 2^n-1]/(2^n)}, While[Mod[m, p] > 0, p = NextPrime@ p]; p]; Array[f, 27, 2] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Nov 14 2015 *)
results.author: _Alexander Adamchuk_, Jul 04 2006
ext: a(16)-a(28) from _Robert G. Wilson v_, Nov 14 2015
